job description:
Position Summary:

The Consultant leads
the development of creative, analytically driven solutions to complex
healthcare industry problems which will assist clients plan and manage more
effectively. Has expertise in managing and analyzing large data sets including
but not limited to patient and management data and consumer survey research.
Skilled in building complex algorithms and models and serves as a resource to
other analytical and consulting staff. From time to time, also
interacts/consults with the client in relevant matters within the scope of a
project.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develops creative and
    analytically driven solutions by employing operations research, advanced
    statistical and mathematical science techniques such as mathematical
    modeling, statistical analysis, linear and non-linear
    regression analysis, stochastic modeling and mathematical
    optimization.
  • Able to determine optimal
    or near-optimal solutions to complex decision-making problems in the areas
    of healthcare operations, workforce optimization, pricing strategy, and
    strategic and financial planning.
  • Understands the benefits
    and limitations of various statistical and mathematical approaches and is
    able to communicate to colleagues and clients.
  • Utilizing advanced
    mathematical & statistical methodologies, develops and leads scenario
    modeling events in partnership with directors and consultants to assist
    clients in transforming their enterprise.
  • Creates complex models and algorithms drawing
    from diverse, large and complex data. Can translate client and consultant
    requirements & constraints into mathematical models.
  • Builds analytical/optimization models to
    improve the financial and patient care metrics.
  • Participate in both client & internal
    discussions to explain model output.
  • Enable implementation of the models through
    education, training and technology support.
  • Build measurement system to track the impact
    of the changes and report the same.
  • Participate in research to constantly try and
    bring in new analytical/operations research/process improvement
    methodologies and techniques to improve healthcare operations and KHA
    approaches to complex industrial problems.
  • Advises software developers in the creation of
    commercial products.
Key
Technical Skills Needed:
  • Has knowledge and experience in utilizing advanced
    mathematics as applied to a business setting, for example, linear programming,
    optimization modeling, operations research, logistics science.
  • Hands on experience with Microsoft Excel (basic
    excel functions, advanced excel functions including macro programming).
  • Hands on experience with solvers like Excel based
    Lindo solver, Matlab programming (Knowledge of MS Access and Tableau is a
    plus).
  • Excellent computer skills; proficiency in all
    current business applications and software, including but not limited to Word,
    Power Point.
  • Data mining experience using statistical software
    like SAS. (SPSS is an additional benefit).
  • Knowledge,
    experience and overlap with other disciplines, notably industrial engineering and management science, and draws on psychology and organization science.
  • Knowledgeable in basic Toyota Lean/Six Sigma and/or
    TQM or related process evaluation and process improvement techniques.
  • Basic understanding of root cause analysis.

    Key
    Financial Skills Needed:
  • Possesses basic financial management skills related
    to planning, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting. Understands the
    interdependencies of these systems.
  • Ability to gather and analyze financial performance
    data.
  • Basic understanding of accounts payable/receivable
    processes.
  • Able to construct a basic financial pro forma
    including cost benefit analysis and clinical implications of
    decision/deployment strategy changes.

    Key
    Communication and Consultation Skills Needed:
  • Very good communication skills – oral and written
  • Ability to construct verbal and written messages
    for a variety of audiences, i.e. executives, managers, subordinates,
    consultants and clients.
  • Ability to assess client needs, outline project
    goals, define project deliverables, and establish timelines.

    Other Skills Needed:
    • Ability to grasp operational concepts and
      processes.
  • Proactive behavior with a strong problem solving
    orientation.
  • Solid interpersonal, influencing, and communicating
    skills across all levels and functions.
  • Self-directed individual able to operate
    independently and work efficiently in a team environment.
  • Ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks in
    a fast paced environment.
  • Unquestionable commitment to personal and corporate
    integrity in every situation.
  • Self-directed; critical thinking skills; strong
    service standard.
  • Aligns own work with organizational goals and
    ethical standards.
  • Self-directed learner who keeps abreast of evolving
    analytical methodologies, tools, techniques and technologies.

    Education & Experience:
  • Master
    Degree in Statistics (Bachelors in Computer
    Science is plus).
  • 3-5
    years of progressive experience required. Healthcare finance/operations
    experience is a plus.
  • Prior
    consulting experience preferred.

    Kaufman, Hall, & Associates, LLC. is an equal
    opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will be
    considered without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin,
    marital status, ancestry, citizenship, veteran status, sexual orientation or
    preference, or physical or mental disability or other legally protected
    category.
